intro: Brayera abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian brayer, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
